header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AudienceCount; integer; Audience count associated with the campaign.
  • AudienceId; integer; Audience identifier.
  • CreatedBy; string; Person who added the metrics.
  • CreationDate; string; Date when the metrics were added to the campaign.
  • EntityId; integer; Entity identifier for the audience criteria.
  • EntityName; string; Name of the selected entity.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date when the audience metrics were last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; Session login associated to the user who last updated the audience metrics.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; Person who last updated the audience metrics.
  • MetricId; integer; Internal identifier for a metric.
  • MetricType; string; Types of metrics.
  • ObjectVersionNumber; integer; Version number associated with the audience metrics that the user retrieved.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all audience metrics using a unique identifier.
    Finder Variables
    • MetricId; integer; Metric identifier and unique identifier used to find audience metrics.
  • findByMetricType Finds all metrics using a metric type.
    Finder Variables
    • MetricType; string; Metric type used to find metrics.

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AssetId; integer; Internal identifier of the audience segment.
  • AssetSegmentId; integer; Segment identifier for the audience segment.
  • CreatedBy; string; Person who created the audience segment.
  • CreationDate; string; Date when the audience segment was created.
  • CriteriaTypeCode; string; Criteria type code of the audience segment.
  • GoalResponseId; integer; Goal response identifier for the audience segments associated with the goal.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date when the audience segment was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; Last session login associated to the user who last updated the audience segment.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; Person who last updated the audience segment.
  • ObjectVersionNumber; integer; Version number of the audience segment that the user retrieved.
  • SegmentTypeCode; string; Segment type code of the audience segment.

    • AssetSegmentId; integer; Segment identifier and unique identifier used to find audience segments.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AssetId; integer; Internal identifier for a channel's metrics.
  • PrimaryClickedCount; number; Unique number of times primary action was clicked.
  • SecondaryClickedCount; number; Unique number of times secondary action was clicked.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all the metrics associated with a channel using a unique identifier.
    Finder Variables
    • AssetId; integer; Internal identifier for a channel's metrics.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

  • ContentLastModified; string; Date when the campaign content was last modified.

  • Frequency; string; Frequency with which the grow notification email is sent out.

  • SentCount; number; Count of all the campaign emails sent so far.
  • StartDeliveryDate; string; Date when the campaign email was first delivered.
  • SubjectCode; string; Subject code to identify the recruiting or communicate campaign asset.
  • TotalCount; number; Total audience count associated with the campaign.
  • UndeliveredCount; number; Count of all the campaign emails undelivered so far.
  • UnsentCount; number; Count of all the campaign emails unsent so far.
  • UnsubscribedCount; integer; Count of all the campaign emails unsubscribed so far.

Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • CampaignId; integer; Campaign identifier in the associated job requisition metrics.
  • GoalTypeCode; string; Goal type for the job requisition metrics.
  • MetricCount; number; Response count for the job requisition metrics.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds all job requisition metrics by primary key.
    Finder Variables
    • CampaignId; integer; Campaign ID used to find job requisition metrics.
    • GoalTypeCode; string; Goal type code used to find job requisition metrics.

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • CampaignId; integer; Campaign identifier in the requisition.
  • CampaignRequisitionId; integer; Requisition identifier of the requisition associated with a campaign.
  • CreatedBy; string; Person who created the requisition.
  • CreationDate; string; Date when the requisition was added to the campaign.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date when the requisition associated with the campaign was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; Session login associated to the user who last updated the requisition associated to the campaign.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; Person who last updated the requisition associated to the campaign.
  • ObjectVersionNumber; integer; Version number of the requisition associated to the campaign.
  • RequisitionId; integer; Identifier of the requisition associated ot the campaign.

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

  • CampaignName; string; Name of the campaign.

  • ClosedOnDate; string; Date on which the campaign was closed.

  • CreationDate; string; Date on which the campaign was created.
  • EligObjId; integer; Internal key defined for the combination of the campaign and audience selection.
  • EligPrflId; integer; Internal identifier for the eligibility profile associated with a campaign audience.
  • HCMListExtractionDate; string; Date when the HCM list was extracted.
  • HCMListId; integer; Internal identifier for the HCM list associated with a campaign audience.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date on which the campaign was last updated.
